newsitem.title: POLAND: EBRD, BANK OF AMERICA TO INVEST IN POLISH HORTEX.
newsitem.headline: EBRD, BANK OF AMERICA TO INVEST IN POLISH HORTEX.

text.p: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) and Bank of America will get a stake in Polish food processor and trader Hortex by the end of September 1997, a Hortex shareholder said on Monday.

Bank Gospodarki Zywnosciowej SA (BGZ), which has 41.2 percent in Hortex said in a statement it had signed an agreement with EBRD, Bank of America on the conditions of their investment in Hortex through a capital increase.
It said Bank Handlowy, another Hortex's shareholder, also signed the agreement but added the transaction's conditions would yet have to be approved by the managements of the firms involved.
It did not give any further details and EBRD's officials were not immediately available for comment.
According to independent market research institute Indicator Hortex is Poland's biggest juice producer with a 41 -percent market share.
According to a newspaper report in October last year, EBRD planned to invest up to $40 million in Hortex, but EBRD denied those reports.
